text: Makaji Meghpar () (also known as Meghana) is a village and was former chiefdom of Hardhrol Jadeja chieftains in the Jamnagar district of Gujarat, India. It was founded in 1754 by Makanji Jadeja of Dhrol State. Gujarati author Harilal Upadhyay is from the village. The peoples are mainly Jadeja Rajputs with some Brahmins,>Patels and Shudras. ==References== Category:Villages in Gujarat
title: Makaji Meghpar
